definition: threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: We have a lot of fun at the fairground today.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天在游乐场上玩得很开心。

sentences.english: We intend to have a ball at the amusement park today.
sentences.chinese: 我们打算今天到游乐场玩个痛快。

sentences.english: So Mrand Mrs. White took their children to the funfair Mr.
sentences.chinese: 因此，怀特夫妇带着他们的孩子们去了游乐场。

sentences.english: It's a lot of fun, It's like a big playground, you know.
Days Virginia , Busch Gardens, Chesapeake Bay Bridge-Tunnel Tour.
sentences.chinese: 三天维珍尼亚，万里长桥，普希花园游乐场。

sentences.english: The paradise was already Alices playground.
sentences.chinese: 这天堂已经是爱丽丝的游乐场。

sentences.english: He watched her as greedily as he had watched her in the playground.
sentences.chinese: 斯内普渴慕地望着她，就像游乐场上望着她时一样。

sentences.english: There is a carnie in the middle of the park .
sentences.chinese: 在公园中间有一个游乐场。

sentences.english: They are the playground of hordes of Hong Kong Chinese, especially at the weekends.
sentences.chinese: 这里也是众多香港人的游乐场，尤其是在周末的时候。
它是一个世界著名的游乐场。

sentences.english: Small Rabbit brings Small Boy to an amusement park.
sentences.chinese: 梦梦兔带粗眉仔飞到一个游乐场。

sentences.english: The renovated amusement park has a brand-new image.
sentences.chinese: 整修后的游乐场新姿夺目。

sentences.english: Turn love into a carnie, to make smile stay on my face forever.
sentences.chinese: 把爱变成游乐场，让俄开心的笑一辈子不走。

sentences.english: The playground is the children's favourite haunt.
sentences.chinese: 游乐场乃孩子们常爱去的地方。

sentences.english: The little girl has been pestering her parents to take her to the funfair.
sentences.chinese: 小女孩一直缠着她的父母带她去游乐场。

sentences.english: The shopping centre offers restaurants, cinemas , funfairs and so on.
sentences.chinese: 这个购物中心有餐馆，电影院，游乐场等设施。

definition: merry-go-round/carousel/Carousel, South Korean TV soap opera
Disneyland/also written 迪士尼樂園|迪士尼乐园[Di2 shi4 ni2 Le4 yuan2]
sandpit (for children's play or for long jump etc)/sandbox
to play (as children do)/to amuse oneself
